Question.Text: A 7-year-old girl presents to a clinic in Peru with fever, myalgia, arthralgia, skin lesions/rash/itching, nausea/vomiting.

Answer: The 7-year-old girlâ€™s symptoms are consistent with a viral infection such as dengue fever or chikungunya, both common in Peru and characterized by fever, myalgia, arthralgia, and rash.
